summary_and_description:
Incorrect context menu display during bookmark searches

Environment: Windows XP, Build 20021004

Reproduction Steps:
1. Activate bookmarks panel and highlight any bookmark/folder
2. Perform a search that filters out the initially selected bookmark, leaving empty space
3. Right-click the blank area

Observed Behavior:
The right-click menu shows options for the previously selected (now hidden) bookmark instead of being empty.

Root Cause:
Likely related to selection state persistence during searches (see Bug 156576). Suggested fix: Clear selection when initiating a search.
